fields.headline: Step Up
fields.bodyText: (103 mins, PG) Directed by Anne Fletcher; starring Channing Tatum, Jenna Dewan, Mario, Rachel Griffiths Set in Baltimore, Step Up announces its theme behind the opening credits by cutting rapidly between a classical ballet class and a group of black breakdancers. The film's 'wigger' (played by Brad Pitt lookalike Channing Tatum) trashes a stage at the Maryland School for the Arts with his black chums, is caught and sentenced to 200 hours of community service at the school. He's a hip hop performer who despises classical music, but, suddenly, the school's top ballerina needs a partner for a gala event. So they join forces and put on a breakdance ballet on the very stage that, two months earlier, he'd demolished. This is a cliche-ridden movie by people to whom formula is clearly mother's milk.
